channel.title: Viktor Barzin's Site
channel.description: Recent content on Viktor Barzin's Site

item.title: 02 Blog a Blog
item.description: Keypoints: busy around hackconf simple blog about how this blog was made

item.title: 01 Secure by default - Why you shouldn't disable Django's CSRF middleware
item.description: Brief intro Recently I’ve been messing around with various client-side web attacks. I’ve noticed that most web devs’ knowledge goes as far as the framework their using requires and that’s it. When asked what is the purpose of a csrf token, they would say - “Oh, it’s something for security and if I don’t put it, my forms don’t work so it must be there.” If you find yourself having a similar answer, keep on reading.

item.title: About me
item.description: Hi there! I’m Viktor. I’m {{ current_year }} - 1998 years old and I’m currently doing my BSc in Computer Science at the University of Southampton. You can find me on facebook, twitter and github. I’m all into information security. I love solving interesting and challenging problems and I also enjoy helping others learn new stuff. In my free time I watch Formula 1, play chess and soon I’ll be jumping out of planes
